title: ASN RDAP Lookup
subtitle: Query Autonomous System Number allocation and registration data using RDAP through Regional Internet Registries. ASNs identify networks on the global Internet routing table and are essential for BGP routing operations.

google.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for AS15169 (Google LLC - Major cloud provider)

cloudflare.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for AS13335 (Cloudflare - CDN and security services)

amazon.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for AS16509 (Amazon.com - AWS cloud infrastructure)

microsoft.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for AS8075 (Microsoft Corporation - Azure cloud)

meta.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for AS32934 (Meta Platforms - Facebook services)

googleCloud.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for AS396982 (Google Cloud Platform - Additional ranges)

form.title: RDAP Lookup Configuration
form.asnTooltip: Enter an Autonomous System Number to query allocation data via RDAP
form.asnHint: Supports both formats: AS15169 or 15169 (AS prefix is optional)

results.title: RDAP Data for {asn}
results.rdapServiceTooltip: RDAP service used for the query

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Tips:
troubleshooting.validFormat: Ensure the ASN format is valid (e.g., AS15169 or just 15169)
troubleshooting.asnExists: Check if the ASN exists and is currently allocated
troubleshooting.privateASN: Private ASNs (64512-65534, 4200000000-4294967294) may not have public RDAP data
troubleshooting.rateLimiting: Some RIRs may have rate limiting or access restrictions
troubleshooting.tryAgain: Try again in a few moments if the service is temporarily unavailable

whatIsASN.title: What is an ASN?
whatIsASN.description: Autonomous System Numbers identify networks on the global Internet routing table and are essential for BGP routing operations. Each ASN represents a collection of IP address blocks under unified administrative control.
